meanings.definition: To pay money as a penalty or compensation.
meanings.sent1: I had to feese a fine for parking in the wrong spot.
meanings.sent2: She feeses the landlord every month for rent.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy had to feese by giving extra treats.
meanings.sent4: His conscience feesed him for not helping his friend.
meanings.sent5: The company feesed a hefty sum for the damages caused.

meanings.definition: A fee or charge for a service.
meanings.sent1: The doctor's feese for the check-up was reasonable.
meanings.sent2: The feese for the concert tickets was quite high.
meanings.sent3: The feese for the magic show included a free hat.
meanings.sent4: The feese for the online course opened doors to knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The feese for the gym membership was worth the benefits.

meanings.definition: To assess a fee or charge.
meanings.sent1: The committee will feese the cost of the event tickets.
meanings.sent2: They feese a fee for late returns at the library.
meanings.sent3: The teacher will feese a penalty for missing assignments.
meanings.sent4: The bank will feese a charge for overdrawing the account.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic will feese for the repair work done on the car.

meanings.definition: A payment made to a professional for services rendered.
meanings.sent1: The feese to the plumber was for fixing the leak.
meanings.sent2: She left a generous feese for the excellent service.
meanings.sent3: The feese to the hairdresser included a tip for the stylist.
meanings.sent4: The feese to the painter was for the beautiful mural.
meanings.sent5: He handed over the feese to the electrician for the rewiring.
